text: there are a number of reasons to cook
sardines they taste great they're not
endangered they're cheap they're fast
any fishmonger will gut them for you you
can do it yourself and we're just gonna
stuff each one with a little bit of
thyme and lemon shove it in that cavity
don't fuss the benefit of stuffing as
opposed to laying it on the top is that
in theory at least your imbuing the fish
with flavor but you're also allowing the
top to brown which is what we want when
they're fresh they're really clean and
taste like the sea we have a broiling
pan heating up in the broiler it's
really hot do that they're starting to
cook already a little olive oil on top
when the fish is browned it's done if
your broiler is really hot
it'll Brown more deeply and nicer than
this that's pretty nice that's what I
call a serving with a lemon parsley
would be nice also
there's nothing Dingley clever or fancy
here it's a simple humble fish prepared
simply and humbly and it's really
delicious
